events.message: The insured filed a claim reporting a car collision that occurred last night at the intersection. They provided initial details of the accident and described moderate damage to the vehicle.
The claim has been reviewed and categorised under the Auto Accident cluster based on the presence of keywords like 'car' and 'collision' mentioned in the report.
An agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to the case to ensure quicker assistance and thorough understanding of the vehicle damages reported.
The insured was sent confirmation acknowledging the receipt of their claim and outlining the next steps in the investigation process.
The claimant was requested to submit photos of vehicle damage, police report, and proof of ownership to facilitate the investigation.
The insured submitted all requested documents, including detailed images of the damage and a copy of the police accident report.
The investigation team began evaluating all submitted evidence and contacting witnesses to assess vehicle damage and fault in the collision.
The investigation concluded that the other party was fully responsible for the accident, validating the claim and damage assessment.
A settlement offer covering the repair costs and rental vehicle expenses was proposed to the claimant for review.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the handling of the case so far.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department after all documentation and investigations were found in order.
Payment was issued promptly to the claimantâ€™s designated account to cover the vehicle repairs and associated costs.
The claim was officially closed after payment was confirmed and the claimant had no further questions or issues.
All case files and documents were archived for future reference in accordance with company policy.
